Data.Text: Stream Visualizer is an application that can be used to visualize, capture and replay data streams.
Specifies that the streams specified in <port> received on <interface> should be included in the stream selection list.

The name of the port to receive streams on. If no ranges are given, a test packet is retrieved from the specified port to build a list of possible streams before the visualization begins. When receiving from text ports, <name> is the path to the file or pipe from which to read the streams. Additionally, <name> can be "-" to receive from standard input when receiving from text ports. When receiving from YARP ports, <name> is the name of the YARP port.
A path to the stream, subpaths are seperated by dots. For example "1.2.3" specifies that the stream should be generated from the third value in the second list in the first list of the port.
The name of the stream. This is displayed in the stream selection list.
Enables or disables timestamp mode. In timestamp mode, timestamps will be retrieved from the first stream of each port instaed of the local machine's system time.
Enables or disables minimal mode. In minimal mode, everything except for the graph area is hidden from the user interface to maximize the available drawing-space. The default value is disabled.

Enables or disables the graph extension feature. When graph extension is enabled, all graphs that have at least one sampled data entry are extended across the whole width of the coordinate system using known adjacent values. The default value is enabled.
Enables or disables the regular clearing of old received data. Enable if you plan to run the visualizer for a long time and you don't want to save the results. The default value is disabled.
Lets you specify the type of time manager that is used. The default value is "c".
Continuous time manager. The graphs are drawn across the entire drawing-area, the most recent data entry lies on the right border of the drawing-area.

Shifting time manager. The graphs will shift <c> times the drawing-area width to the left whenever the most recent data entry reaches the right border of the drawing-area. The default value for <c> is "0.8".

Wrapping time manager. The graphs don't move at all, once the most recent data entry reaches the right border, the graphs wrap around and draw over the oldest entries starting from the left. The most recent data entry will push a gap of <c> times the drawing-area width in front of it. The default value for <c> is "0.2".
Lets you specify the width of the drawing-area in total seconds. The default value is "10".
Lets you specify the type of value manager that is used. The default value is "d".
Fitting (dynamic) value manager. The Y-Axis will be automatically scaled to fit all the values that are currently visualized.
Fixed (static) value manager. You can manually specify the range of values along the Y-Axis. The default value for <low>:<high> is "0:1".
Lets you specify the width (thickness) of the graph lines in pixels. The default value is "1.0".
Sets the number of markers that are displayed on the X-Axis. The default value is "5".
Sets the number of markers that are displayed on the Y-Axis. The default value is "5".
Sets the diagram color (coordinate system and labels) in HTML notation. The default value is "FFFFFF".
Sets the background color in HTML notation. The default value is "000000".
